name: read_csv
description: Read a CSV file and return its contents

arguments.name: limit
arguments.desc: Limit number of rows to read (optional)

name: write_csv
description: Write data to a CSV file

arguments.name: overwrite
arguments.desc: Whether to overwrite existing file (default: true)

name: append_csv
description: Append rows to an existing CSV file

arguments.name: rows
arguments.desc: Array of objects representing rows to append

name: get_csv_info
description: Get information about a CSV file

name: query_csv
description: Query a CSV file with filtering, sorting, and column selection

name: search_csv
description: Search for text in CSV file

arguments.name: columns
arguments.desc: Columns to search in (optional, searches all columns if not provided)

name: transform_csv
description: Transform CSV data (add/remove/rename columns, filter rows)

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: merge_csv
description: Merge two CSV files based on a common key

arguments.name: leftFile
arguments.desc: Path to the left CSV file

arguments.name: rightFile
arguments.desc: Path to the right CSV file

arguments.name: leftKey
arguments.desc: Column name to join on in left file

arguments.name: rightKey
arguments.desc: Column name to join on in right file

arguments.name: type
arguments.desc: Type of join (inner, left, right, outer)

name: aggregate_csv
description: Aggregate CSV data with GROUP BY and aggregation functions

name: analyze_csv
description: Get statistics and analysis of CSV file

arguments.name: column
arguments.desc: Specific column to analyze (optional, analyzes all if not provided)

name: calculate_stats
description: Calculate advanced statistics and metrics from CSV columns

name: generate_chart
description: Generate chart/graph data from CSV for visualization

arguments.name: chartType
arguments.desc: Type of chart (bar, line, pie, scatter, histogram)

arguments.name: yColumn
arguments.desc: Column name for Y-axis (or value column for pie charts)

name: apply_formula
description: Apply mathematical formulas to CSV data columns

arguments.name: resultColumn
arguments.desc: Name for the new column with formula results

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: update_cell
description: Update a specific cell value in a CSV file

arguments.name: rowIndex
arguments.desc: Row index (0-based, first data row is 0)

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: update_row
description: Update an entire row or specific fields in a row

arguments.name: rowIndex
arguments.desc: Row index (0-based, first data row is 0)

arguments.name: updates
arguments.desc: Object with column names as keys and new values

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: update_column
description: Update all values in a specific column

arguments.name: value
arguments.desc: New value for all cells in the column (or use formula instead)

arguments.name: formula
arguments.desc: Formula to apply to each row (e.g., column1 * 2). Mutually exclusive with value

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: update_cells_conditional
description: Update cells that match a specific condition

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: delete_rows
description: Delete specific rows by index or condition

arguments.name: rowIndices
arguments.desc: Array of row indices to delete (0-based)

arguments.name: condition
arguments.desc: Condition to match rows for deletion (e.g., {"status": "deleted"})

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: validate_csv
description: Validate CSV data against rules and constraints

name: clean_csv
description: Clean and normalize CSV data

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: deduplicate_csv
description: Find and remove duplicate rows in CSV

arguments.name: columns
arguments.desc: Columns to use for duplicate detection (optional, uses all if not specified)

arguments.name: outputPath
arguments.desc: Path for output file (optional, defaults to overwrite)

name: convert_csv
description: Convert CSV to other formats (JSON, XML, Markdown, SQL, HTML)

arguments.name: format
arguments.desc: Output format (json, json_array, xml, markdown, sql, html)

name: split_csv
description: Split a large CSV file into multiple smaller files

arguments.name: splitBy
arguments.desc: How to split the file (rows, column_value)

arguments.name: rowsPerFile
arguments.desc: Number of rows per file (required if splitBy is rows)

arguments.name: column
arguments.desc: Column to split by (required if splitBy is column_value)

name: combine_csv
description: Combine multiple CSV files into one

arguments.name: filepaths
arguments.desc: Paths to CSV files to combine

arguments.name: skipHeaders
arguments.desc: Skip headers from subsequent files (vertical mode only)

name: sample_csv
description: Sample data from CSV file using various sampling methods

arguments.name: method
arguments.desc: Sampling method (random, stratified, systematic, head, tail)

arguments.name: size
arguments.desc: Sample size (number of rows or percentage)

arguments.name: stratifyColumn
arguments.desc: Column to stratify by (required for stratified sampling)

arguments.name: step
arguments.desc: Step size for systematic sampling (e.g., every nth row)

name: pivot_csv
description: Create a pivot table from CSV data

arguments.name: index
arguments.desc: Columns to use as row index

arguments.name: columns
arguments.desc: Column whose values will become new columns

arguments.name: aggFunc
arguments.desc: Aggregation function (sum, avg, count, min, max, first, last)

name: unpivot_csv
description: Unpivot/melt CSV data from wide to long format

arguments.name: idColumns
arguments.desc: Columns to keep as identifiers (not unpivot)

arguments.name: valueColumns
arguments.desc: Columns to unpivot (optional, unpivots all others if not specified)

arguments.name: varName
arguments.desc: Name for the variable column (default: variable)

arguments.name: valueName
arguments.desc: Name for the value column (default: value)
